column2: In Photos: Exclusive first look at New College House West
column3: New College House West is welcoming its first residents after two years of construction. Here's an exclusive first look at its features.

column2: Your questions about Penn move-in, answered
column3: Students will need to be masked and vaccinated in order to enter their dorms.

column2: New College House West welcomes students for social, amenity-filled living experience
column3: The building, which cost a record-shattering $169.5 million to complete, offers suite-style apartments with a dining cafe, private courtyard, coffee bar, and spectacular views of the city.

column2: Five Guys to open on Penn's campus this fall
column3: Five Guys is a casual eatery which serves fast food like hamburgers and french fries.

column2: Ten tips for navigating your first in-person semester at Penn
column3: The Daily Pennsylvanian reached out to Penn students and faculty for advice on how incoming first years, transfer students, and sophomores can succeed in their first in-person semester.

column2: Class of 2024 to attend first-ever second-year orientation
column3: Members of the Class of 2024 will be able to participate in specialized programming overseen by the office of New Student Orientation & Academic Initiatives.

column2: New sushi bar and expanded meal swipe options among Penn Dining’s fall semester updates
column3: Penn Dining will also open several new dining locations and will use electronic kiosks and mobile apps to streamline the ordering process.

column2: In-person classes and accessible class recordings: A guide to Penn’s academic scene
column3: Undergraduate courses will be delivered in person with limited exceptions, remaining in line with administrators’ original plans announced in April.

column2: Here's how Penn's amenities will operate this fall
column3: From libraries to gyms, there will be a variety of facilities open for student use this semester.

column2: Professors improvise COVID-19 classroom safety measures as Delta variant surges
column3: Concerned about the rise in Philadelphia's COVID-19 cases linked to Delta variant, some faculty members are improvising their own classroom safety measures while anticipating further guidance from Penn.

column2: Penn professors largely optimistic Gutmann can rebuild relations as U.S. ambassador to Germany
column3: Some Penn professors hope Gutmann can repair U.S.-Germany relations, particularly as Germany will be going through a transition period after their federal election next month.

column2: A rundown of Penn’s FGLI student resources this fall
column3: Students can join various FGLI-oriented clubs and take advantage of academic resources

column2: The lessons we should take from online class
column3: The Editorial Board argues that professors should carry over some practices of the virtual semesters to in-person learning.

column2: This semester, let’s add gratitude to our routine
column3: Columnist Jaden Cloobeck speaks to how we can improve mental wellness on campus, such as by keeping a gratitude journal.
